title: Atlético Cajazeirense de Desportos
text:
Atlético Cajazeirense de Desportos, commonly known as Atlético, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Cajazeiras">Cajazeiras</a>, <a href="Para%C3%ADba">Paraíba state</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> once and in the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a> twice.
History.
The club was founded on July 21, 1948. Atlético won the <a href="Campeonato%20Paraibano">Campeonato Paraibano</a> in 2002. They competed in the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a> in <a href="2003%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2003</a>, when they were eliminated in the First Round by <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Bahia">Bahia</a>, and in <a href="2004%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2004</a>, when they were eliminated in the First Round by <a href="Fortaleza%20Esporte%20Clube">Fortaleza</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> in <a href="2007%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">2007</a>, when they were eliminated in the Second Stage of the competition.
Stadium.
Atlético Cajazeirense de Desportos play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Perp%C3%A9tuo%20Corr%C3%AAa%20Lima">Estádio Perpétuo Corrêa Lima</a>, nicknamed "Perpetão". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 4,500 people.
